benchmark_details.name: UI2V-Bench (Understanding-based Image-to-Video Generation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: UI2V-Bench is a benchmark for evaluating image-to-video (I2V) generation models, focusing on semantic understanding and reasoning abilities across four primary evaluation dimensions: spatial understanding, attribute binding, category understanding, and reasoning. It introduces new metrics and methods for assessing these capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic and reliable framework for evaluating image-to-video models, emphasizing semantic comprehension and logical reasoning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently only includes typical and common evaluation dimensions, lacking cases for complex spatial arrangements.

data.source: Approximately 500 carefully constructed text-image pairs sourced from open-access websites such as Unsplash and Pexels.
data.annotation: Human evaluations along with automated MLLM-based metrics.

methods: Instance-level evaluation based on semantic understanding
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the alignment of generated videos with input prompts and expected outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better semantic alignment and reasoning capabilities, as assessed by MLLMs and human evaluators.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations show strong alignment with the proposed metrics.
